metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Very often in programming, you will need a data type that can only have one of two values, like:
content.html: Very often in programming, you will need a data type that can only have one of two values, like:

content.text: For this, Java has a boolean data type, which can only take the values true or false :
content.html: For this, Java has a boolean data type, which can only take the values true or false:

content.code:
boolean
isJavaFun
=

true
;


boolean
isFishTasty
=

false
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
isJavaFun
)
;

// Outputs true


System
.
out
.
println
(
isFishTasty
)
;

// Outputs false
content.code_html:
boolean isJavaFun = true;
boolean isFishTasty = false;
System.out.println(isJavaFun);     // Outputs true
System.out.println(isFishTasty);   // Outputs false

content.text: Boolean values are mostly used for conditional testing.
content.html: Boolean values are mostly used for conditional testing.

content.text: You will learn much more about booleans and conditions later in this tutorial.
content.html: You will learn much more about booleans and conditions later in this tutorial.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the correct syntax for declaring a boolean variable in Java?
